comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: August, 1913: Before the Suffragette Caravan left New York for Boston, pulled by a balky horse that the ladies had named "Asquith," (after the British prime minister, who also proved balky on the woman suffrage question) the participants (three British suffragettes and an American Salvation Army colonel -- with tambourine) released several Boston homing pigeons, whose flight home was supposed to precede their own arrival in that city. Here is a contemporary newspaper clipping about the event: www.elizabethfreeman.org/PDF/suffrage/bostonPigeons_big.pdf

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Wystan and Richard Arthur Norton:

Thanks for the additional information about Ms. Freeman. We will update the record with her full name.
